intro: Euphrasia qaiseri, commonly known as the Jordanian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East, particularly Jordan. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Euphrasia qaiseri has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain its seeds. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
